enWisdom: Affectation is from the morals of the hypocrites
The discarding of hardships [one endures for attaining worldly gain] is the best of acquisitions
The most felicitous lifestyle is achieved by abandoning unnecessary constraints [and formalities]
Dismissal with kindness is one of the two reliefs

Wisdom: مَنْ شَاقَّ وَعِرَتْ عَلَيْهِ طُرُقُهُ وَأَعْضَلَ عَلَيْهِ أَمْرُهُ وَضَاقَ عَلَيْهِ مَخْرَجُهُ
enWisdom: Whoever shows enmity [with the people] his paths becomes rugged, his affair becomes difficult and his way out becomes narrow

Wisdom: مَنْ كَلَّفَكَ مَا لَا تُطِيقُ فَقَدْ أَفْتَاكَ فِي عِصْيَانِهِ
enWisdom: One who imposes upon you a duty that you are unable to bear has indeed asked you to disobey him

Wisdom: لَا تُقْدِمْ عَلَى مَا تَخْشَى الْعَجْزَ عَنْهُ
enWisdom: Do not undertake that which you are afraid of being incapable of
Do not close a door which you are unable to open
Do not shoot an arrow that you are unable to turn back

Wisdom: لَا تَشْتَغِلْ بِمَا لَا يَعْنِيكَ وَلَا تَتَكَلَّفْ فَوْقَ مَا يَكْفِيكَ وَاجْعَلْ كُلَّ هَمِّكَ لِمَا يُنْجِيكَ
enWisdom: Do not busy yourself with that which is of no concern to you, and do not take upon yourself more than what is enough for you, and exert all your efforts for that which will save you
